meanings.sent1: In isonomy, every person is treated fairly by the legal system.
meanings.sent2: The concept of isonomy ensures that everyone has the same rights in court.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny situation when the judge accidentally mixed up isonomy with autonomy in his ruling.
meanings.sent4: The idea of isonomy is like a shield that protects individuals from unfair treatment.
meanings.sent5: The principle of isonomy is like a bright beacon guiding us towards justice.

meanings.definition: The principle of equal political rights for all citizens.
meanings.sent1: Citizens cherish isonomy as it guarantees their equal political rights.
meanings.sent2: In a democracy, isonomy ensures that every citizen has a voice in governance.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the candidates debate the importance of isonomy in the election.
meanings.sent4: The notion of isonomy is a powerful force that unites people in the pursuit of democracy.
meanings.sent5: The principle of isonomy stands tall as a pillar of democracy, ensuring fairness for all.
